Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of TPF Chemotherapy Followed by Surgery in Borderline Resectable Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a single-center phase 2 trial

Participants.evidence: patients aged 18–70 with histologically confirmed BR-ESCC and an ECOG performance status of 0–1

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved TPF chemotherapy followed by surgery if resectable, or concurrent chemoradiation if unresectable.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the efficacy of docetaxel, cisplatin, and fluorouracil (TPF) chemotherapy followed by surgery in patients with borderline resectable esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (BR-ESCC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the R0 resection rate, assessed post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From July 2004 to February 2019, 47 patients were enrolled.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Surgery was performed on 27 patients (57.4%), achieving R0 resection in 25 (53.2%).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median overall survival (OS) was 41.9 months (95% CI, 18.6–65.3), and median progression-free survival (PFS) was 38.7 months (95% CI, 23.5–53.9).

Harms.evidence: No serious perioperative complications or deaths were reported. Adverse events were consistent with known profiles of the chemotherapy regimen.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT02976909).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Center.
